title: Nomenclature
content:
I recently purchased a book cheesily entitled The Secret Universe of Names. It's essentially one of those 'people of X type have Y qualities', but is at least based on statistics rather than completely arbitrary newage gunk. A few phenomes in particular amused me.

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v192/Jimage/keenlike/nomenclature/name-BL.jpg[/img]
[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v192/Jimage/keenlike/nomenclature/name-MRT.jpg[/img]
[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v192/Jimage/keenlike/nomenclature/name-ML.jpg[/img]

It does a good job in a few places of describing Mort and Billy. I'm not so sure that Molly's personality fits, but the overal feminine/nurturing theme clicks as the babysitter role.

Just some random food for thought.

title: Re: Nomenclature
content:
Hehe.. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] Interestingly some of those traits fit well with out characters. Interesting..3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."
